intro: Phacelia davidsonii f. macrantha, commonly known as the Davidson's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. This variety is distinguished by its larger, more prominent flowers compared to other forms of Phacelia davidsonii.
